sentences.english: I have not the gifts that are necessary for scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 浅尝辄止的人是无法做学问的。

sentences.english: What the gentleman worries about is the Way and not poverty.
sentences.chinese: 君子忧患的是没有学问而不忧患贫困。

sentences.english: And what will all her learning and her daintiness do for her, now?
sentences.chinese: 现在她所有的学问和她的文雅对她又有什么用呢？

sentences.english: He is an eminent scholar, but he always keeps his knowledge in the background.
sentences.chinese: 他是位杰出的学者，但他从来不卖弄自己的学问。

sentences.english: That's the silly talk of scholarly people.
sentences.chinese: 那是有学问的人说的傻话。

sentences.english: And paid for learning with your empty praise.
sentences.chinese: 你们对学问的报酬只是空口赞美。

sentences.english: Time to concentrate on studying is a good way of learning.
sentences.chinese: 惜时专心苦读是做学问的一个好方法。

sentences.english: The most useful learning in the world is that which teches us how to die well.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最有用的学问是告诉我们怎样死得其所。

sentences.english: Being busily engaged in study, Professor Smith sported his door.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯教授忙于钻研学问，他闭门谢客。

sentences.english: Ding Hong great learning, who has researched the book right through.
sentences.chinese: 丁鸿很有学问，对经书极有研究。

sentences.english: He who imagines that he has knowledge enough has none.
sentences.chinese: 自以为学识丰富的人是没有什么学问的人。

sentences.english: In conversation, humor is worth more than wit and easiness more than knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 交谈中，幽默重于智慧，轻松重于学问。

sentences.english: I have the preference for learning to wealth.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿有好学问，而不要钱财。

sentences.english: I found the Chen family was as learned as I am.
sentences.chinese: 发现了这陈家人跟我大牛一样有学问。

sentences.english: How to own a car, but also a stress learned.
sentences.chinese: 可怎么养车，也是有讲究有学问的。

sentences.english: Fund raising is an "art" with professional skills and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 劝募是一门学问，包含专业的技术与创意的艺术。

definition: doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
